sentences.sContent: Alfred the Great acted his own spy, visiting Danish camps disguised as a minstrel.
sentences.sContent_eng: Alfred the Great acted his own spy, visiting Danish camps disguised as a minstrel.
sentences.sCn: 他扮作吟游歌手到丹麦军队的营地里侦察。

sentences.sContent: If some minstrel belts out “Imagine” or gets a crowd to sing along hoping to carry away a hatful of coins, this busker could face a fine ranging from $50 to $200.
sentences.sContent_eng: If some minstrel belts out “Imagine” or gets a crowd to sing along hoping to carry away a hatful of coins, this busker could face a fine ranging from $50 to $200.
sentences.sCn: 如果在这片草莓园里，有流浪歌手高歌吟唱他的《想象》或是唱着民谣摇滚，招致大批群众围观，而只是为了能让自己“行乞”的帽子装满硬币的街头艺人们，可能会面临50到200美元不等的罚款。

trans.tranOther: a singer or musician in the Middle Ages
